utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, pick a card, any card. All right, now memorize it. Show to everybody. Got it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Um-mm.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, give it back to me. 5 of hearts.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Real magic does exist.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow. Joey, how do you do it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can't tell you that, no.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, somebody's at the door on the ceiling.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Noo, that's our unbelievably loud upstairs neighbor.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He took up the carpet, and now you can hear everything.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why don't you go up there and ask him to 'step lightly, please?'

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there to yell and then I end up apologizing to him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, that is silly. I'll go up there, I'll tell him to keep it down.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, be my guest.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right, you really wanna know how I did it, I'll show ya. When you handed me back the card, what you didn't see was, I looked at it so fast that it was invisible to the naked eye. I just did it. I just did it, again. Here, I'll slow it down so that you guys can see it.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, I got it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, look I was with my friend downstairs and we hear everything up here that you do, and I am sick and tired... .

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Whoa, you are very beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, anybody got a length of rope about six feet long with a little nouse at the end?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, what's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I just saw Janice.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, she was at Rockefeller Center skating with her husband, she looked so happy. I almost feel bad for whipping that kid's pretzel at them.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Man, I remember the first time I saw that girl Katherine, after we broke up. She was just walking with her friend Donna, just laughing and talking. God, it killed me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, but you ended up having sex with both of them that afternoon.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sorry, I just, any excuse to tell that story y'know....

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Chandler, there's a party tomorrow, you'll feel better then.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, y'know what, I'm gonna be okay, you don't have to throw a party for me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's Joey's birthday.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, well then, if anybody should have a party it should be him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, well he totally screwed up the punch line. Y'know, it's supposed to be arrghh-eh og-errigh.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
utterance.content: How's that coffee comin,' dear?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, right away Mr. Kaplan.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
utterance.content: I'm not supposed to drink coffee, it makes me gassy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
utterance.content: I'll bet your thinking, 'What's an intelligent girl who wants to be in fashion, doing making coffee?' Eh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Op.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
utterance.content: Eh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you got me.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
utterance.content: Well, don't think I haven't noticed your potential. Well, I've got a project for you that's a lot more related to fashion. How does that sound?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
utterance.content: Come on over here, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh thank you so much Mr. Kaplan, thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
utterance.content: I need these hangers separated ASAP. You're welcome.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God, I hate my job, I hate it, I hate my job, I hate it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know honey, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I wanna quit, but then I think I should stick it out, then I think why would such a person stay in such a demeaning job, just because it's remotely related to the field they're interested in.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Gee, I don't know Rach. Order up!! I got a Yentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh honey, come on, I'm sorry, I didn't.... I don't mind paying my dues, y'know, its just how much am I gonna learn about fashion by walking Mira, the arthritic seamstress, to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! Is my misery amusing to you?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I wa, I wa, I was just ah....

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's not funny, this is actually my job.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Oh believe me, I-I-I've been there. I had to sort mannequin heads at that Mannequins Plus.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh well then, so I'm just going to go back to talking to my friend here. And you can go back to enjoying your little hamburger.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Ah, just one other thing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes?!

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: I ah, I work at Bloomingdale's and I might know of a job possibility if your, if your interested?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you want my pickle?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Gunther. Hi. I mean you're going out on a date with the noisy guy upstairs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, he's very charming.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know, he's too charming, but if you two start going out, then it's just gonna make it so much harder for me to hate him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, you're just gonna have to try.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, where are the Jell-o shots?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don't know, Chandler is supposed to be passin' 'em around...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello-dillillio!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, somebody's feeling better.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Stick out your tongue.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Take off your shirt!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God! How many of these things did you have? These are pure vodka.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, Jell-o just like Mom used to make.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The most unbelievable thing happened to me today.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! So I'm out having lunch at Monica's and this guy starts talking to me, and it turns out he works for a buyer at Bloomingdale's and there happens to be an opening in his department. So I gave him my phone number and he's gonna call me this weekend to see if he can get me an interview!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, so this guy is helping you for no apparent reason?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And he's, he's a total stranger?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! His name is um, Mark something.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh. Sounds like Mark Something wants to have some sex.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What!?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I'm just saying, I mean why else would he just, y'know, swoop in out of nowhere for no reason.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: To be nice.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, Joey. Are men ever nice to strange women for no reason?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, only for sex.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you. So did you ah, did you tell Mark Something about me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I didn't have to, because I was wearing my 'I heart Ross' sandwich board and ringing my bell.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!! Hey-hey-hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, how many of that girl are you seeing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joey's sisters.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi Joey's sisters!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Cookie
utterance.content: Hey. What are we drinkin' over here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I have ah, vodka and cranberry juice.

utterance.speaker: Cookie
utterance.content: No kiddin,' that's the exact same drink I made myself right after I shot my husband.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow. Okay, I don't know how to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I'm taking my ex-girlfriend of my speed dialer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no-no, no, it's a good thing. Why must we dial so speedily anyway? Why must we rush through life? Why can't we savor the precious moments? Those are some huge breasts you have.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. So um, I-I heard about this ah, Mark guy that ah, Rachel met today.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Isn't that great?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah! So ah, kinda pretty, pretty good. He sounds like a nice, good guy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, y'know what, when he left I actually used the phrase, 'Hummina-hummina-hummina.'

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's excellent.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, he's just a nice guy. You really think this Mark doesn't want anything in exchange for helping him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I assume I'll have to take showers with him, but y'know, that's true of any job.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How ya feelin'?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, my apartment isn't there anymore, because I drank it.

utterance.content: Where'd you get too? We lost you after you opened up all the presents.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I ended up in the storage room, and not alone.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Woooo hoooo!!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ow, no 'woo-hooing,' no 'woo-hooing.'

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, I fooled around with Joey's sister. Well, that's not the worst part.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is the worse part?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can't remember which sister.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You see what men do! Don't tell me men are not nice! This is men!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, he's actually going to kill you dead.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay! You don't think I thought of that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How can you not know which one?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean that's unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean, was it Gina?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Which one is Gina?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Dark, big hair, with the airplane earrings.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, no, no, that's Dina.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You see you can't tell which one is which either, dwha!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We didn't fool around with any of them. Dwha! Dwha!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Veronica. Look, it's got to be Veronica, the girl in the red skirt. I definitely stuck my tongue down her throat.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That was me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, when I've been drinking, sometimes I tend to get overly friendly, and I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That's all right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can I talk to you for a second?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why can't we talk in here? With, with, witnesses.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I just got off the phone with my sister.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, which, which one?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Mary-Angela.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mary-Angela.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know which one was she again?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why don't you ask Chandler, 'cause he's the one that fooled around with her. She told me you said you could really fall for her. Now is that true? Or are you just gettin' over Janice by groping my sister.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's gotta be the first one.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really? That's great! You and my sister, sittin' in a tree.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yep, I'm in a tree.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Did he call? Did Mark call?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No honey, I'm sorry, but the weekend's not over yet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. Oh my God, is that Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I guess they're back from their date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Music. Very nice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am good. I finished my book.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, what's it about?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't remember. Do you wanna take a walk?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dear Mary-Angela. Hi. How's it going. This is the hardest letter I've ever had to write. What the hell's a matter with you? How do you think Joey's going to react when he finds out that you blew off his sister with a letter?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, that's the part where you tell him that I moved to France. When actually I'll be in Cuba.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, look, look, you've got to do this yourself, okay in person. At least you know her name. You just go to the house and you ask for Mary-Angela, okay, when which ever one she is comes to the door, you take her for a walk, you let her down easy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What if Mary-Angela comes to the door and I ask for Mary-Angela?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Where in Cuba?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey, what-wh-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Waiting for my Grandma to finish my laundry. What about you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm here to see Mary-Angela.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You are so the man! Now look, listen, listen, you got to be cool, 'cause my Grandma doesn't know about you two yet, and you do not want to tick her off. She was like the sixth person to spit on Mussolini's hanging body. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where's Mary-Angela?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She's right in there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can't believe Mark didn't call. It's Sunday night, and he didn't call.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Bummer.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, right. Look at you, you're practically giddy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I'm genuinely sorry the Mark thing didn't work out. Look, Rach, I want only good things for you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute, why don't you just call Mark. I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, you've got to make stuff happen.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But, you, you don't want to seem too pushy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, it's not pushy, he gave her his home number.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, he gave you his home number? As in like, to, to his home?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, and you don't mind if I call, because you only want good things for me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's right good things, that-that is what I said.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello, Mark? Hi, it's Rachel Green. Oh no, don't you apologize. Yeah, I'll hold. He left my number at work, but he was helping his niece with her report on the pioneers.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That is so made up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, oh my God, tomorrow! That, no, it's perfect. Oh God, thank you soo much. Great! Bye! I got the interview!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He even offered to meet me for lunch tomorrow to prep me for it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, that is amazing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah well, if I know Mark, and I think I do, I'd expect nothing less.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I got to figure out what I'm going to wear.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: High collar and baggy pants say I'm a pro.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! Right! Okay, I'll see you guys later. Woo hoo!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You go get 'em. What did I do to you? Did I hurt you in some way?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: 'Why don't you call him?!' Well, thank you very much! Y'know now he is going to prep her, y'know prep her, as in what you do when you surgically remove the boyfriend!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you crazy?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Am I! Am I! Am I out of my mind! Am I losing my senses!! This dreamy guy is taking my girlfriend out for a meal.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! Ross y'know this isn't even about you! I mean this is about Rachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if you're right, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean don't you trust her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Then get over yourself! Grow up!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You grow up.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This teramisu is, is excellent. Did you make it Mary-Angela?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it's, it's yummy. So Mary-Angela do you like it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So um, Mary-Angela, what's your second favorite?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Would you just please....give me the receipt 'cause this is great. It's top notch.

utterance.content: So will I.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no I was just squinting. That doesn't mean anything.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Will you excuse me I have to um.....

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I may have jumped the gun here. Um, I just got out of a relationship and I'm not really in a, in a commitment kind of place.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahhhh, you're not Mary-Angela.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is so bad. If-if you're not Mary-Angela, then-then who is?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, this is soo bad.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No Joey! No Joey! Don't Joey! Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What's goin' on?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're it! Now run and hide!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! How could you do that, how could you think she was Mary-Angela?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wasn't sure which one Mary-Angela was. Look, I'm sorry okay, I was really drunk, and you all look really similar.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah! Punch him!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know what, we should all calm down because your brother's not going to punch me. Are ya?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, that is usually what I would do. But I just never thought you'd be on the receiving end of it. How could you do this?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey if you wanna punch me, go ahead, I deserve it. But I just want you to know that I would never soberly hurt you or your family, you're my best friend. I would never do anything like this ever again.

utterance.content: So what. I say, punch him.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah! Punch him! Punch him!

utterance.content: No! No! No! No, I'm not going to punch Chandler.

utterance.content: No you won't. Look he knows he did a terrible thing and I believe him, he's sorry. But, you've got one more apology to make, all right, you've got to apologize to Mary-Angela.

utterance.content: Okay, absolutely!

utterance.content: All right.

utterance.content: You've got it.

utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.content: How'd did it go?

utterance.content: Oh well, the woman I interviewed with was pretty tough, but y'know thank God Mark coached me, because once I started talking about the fall line, she got all happy and wouldn't shut up.

utterance.content: I'm so proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Me too!

utterance.content: Listen, I'm ah, I'm sorry I've been so crazy and jealous and, it's just that I like you a lot, so...

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Eavesdropping. Pheebs, the ceiling tiles were falling down.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. But I really like this guy. And I think he really happens to like me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Maybe he's just jumping on a pogo-stick and really likes it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Maybe the pogo-stick likes it too?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, that's it! He cannot do this to Phoebe. This guy is going to get the butt kicking of a lifetime! But, is he a big guy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, we'll all go. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks you guys! Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don't worry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: God, I hope they kick his ass!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know if it's any consolation, he really did sound like he was having more fun with you.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: May I help you?
